homepage.title: Vote from abroad
homepage.subtitle: Request a ballot now!
homepage.loginInstructions: Type your email address or mobile phone number to get started.
homepage.tooltip: Your email or number will create an account for you to use to easily sign in to votefromabroad and save your information from year to year. An anonymous session allows you to create an FPCA form and send it to your local election office, but will not save your information for you to return to in the future.

optIn.optIn: Vote From Abroad is a non-partisan platform that helps US citizens vote from abroad by producing the necessary Federal forms. In using this site, only the information necessary for filling out Federal forms related to voting as US citizen overseas is collected. Your data privacy is our top concern. Please read and accept our {privacyPolicy}, {cookiePolicy} and {termsOfUse}.

email.testEmail:
********** 
This message will be sent to {leoEmail} {leoName} after VoteFromAbroad 3.0 is launched. 

 We have NOT sent in your FPCA. 
 **********

error.chunkLoadingFailed: The page has just been updated and will be reloaded. If it is not automatically reloaded, please click refresh in your browser to manually reload.

auth.trivia2: Request your ballot every calendar year to get full Federal Protection for all federal elections each year.
auth.trivia3: Americans have been political abroad since Thomas Jefferson.  He drafted the Bill of Rights while in Paris.
auth.daMemberMessage: As an authenticated member of Democrats Abroad, you can prefill your form with your membership data. Would you like to?
auth.prefilled: Your form has been pre-filled, please verify all information before submitting.
auth.emailDelay: It could take up to a minute to deliver.
auth.correctEmail: Did you enter your email correctly?
auth.notReceiveSms: Can you receive SMS messages on {number}?
auth.correctNumber: Did you enter your number correctly?
auth.indiaAuth: Is your number in India’s Do Not Call Registry?
auth.anonymousStartMessage: You have started an anonymous session.  Please close this window when you are finished to delete all data.
auth.trouble: If you are still having trouble we recommend {0}.
auth.verificationEmail:
Your Verification code is: {code}. 
 -OR- 
 Click and confirm that you want to sign in to VoteFromAbroad.org 
 Sign in to VoteFromAbroad.org 
 You will be automatically redirected and authenticated. This link/code can only be used once and expires in five minutes. If you are having any issues with your account, please don't hesitate to contact us by replying to this mail. Thanks, VoteFromAbroad 
 If you did not make this request, please contact us by replying to this mail.
auth.verificationSMS: Your verification code is: {password} – votefromabroad.org – (This code can only be used once and expires in 5 minutes.)

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: These are the questions we hear most as we help voters abroad register and request their ballot. If you have a question that isn't answered here, please {intercom} with us at {emailLink}. We'd love to hear from you!
faq.question: Question
faq.votingAbroad: Voting as a U.S. Citizen Outside the U.S.
faq.voterRegistration: How to Register to Vote and Get a Ballot
faq.neverResided: U.S. Citizens Who Have Never Resided in the U.S.
faq.fpca: Filling Out the Federal Post Card Application (FPCA)
faq.fwab: Using the Federal Write-in Absentee Ballot (FWAB)

envelopes.title: Postage Paid Envelope Templates
envelopes.intro: You can mail your form postage free from the US or by US military mail/ diplomatic pouch via US Embassies or Consulates. Download and print one of these envelope templates then send your envelope from the US or by US military mail/ diplomatic pouch at a US Embassy or Consulate.
envelopes.help: Be sure to set your printer options for the size of envelope.
envelopes.ballotReturnEnvelope: Ballot Return and FWAB Postage-Paid Return Envelope
envelopes.securityEnvelope: Ballot Return and FWAB Security Envelope

election.title: {state} Elections and Deadlines
election.military: Uniformed Services and eligible family members

states.stateBody: Remember that you need to request a ballot each calendar year that you’d like to vote in. Check below for your primary and general deadlines. {0} to start your ballot request now.

menu.disclaimer:
Public Service provided by Democratic Party Committee Abroad (DemocratsAbroad.org).
This communication is not authorized by any candidate or candidate's committee.

phoneOrEmail.label: Type your email address or mobile phone number to get started.
phoneOrEmail.tooltip: Your email or number will create an account for you to use to easily sign in to votefromabroad and save your information from year to year. An anonymous session allows you to create an FPCA form and send it to your local election office, but will not save your information for you to return to in the future.

messages.required: You must enter a phone number or email address
messages.validPhoneOrEmail: That does not appear to be a valid email address or phone number (starting with + and country code). Please reenter.

codeInput.label-sms: An SMS with the code has been sent to {phone}.
codeInput.label-email: We sent you a link and code to {email}. Click the link in the email or enter the code here to sign in.
codeInput.tooltip: Your email or number will create an account for you to use to easily sign in to votefromabroad and save your information from year to year. An anonymous session allows you to create an FPCA form and send it to your local election office, but will not save your information for you to return to in the future.

messages.required: Please enter the 6 digit code we sent you.
Your last name is required.  Please enter it here.

jurisdiction.label: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.instructions: Type to find your local election official (county, city, town...)
jurisdiction.placeholder: Click to find your voting jurisdiction
jurisdiction.tooltip: All ballots are sent from your local election official in your town, city or county.  You must select the correct election official to receive a ballot.

messages.required: You must select your local election official.

previousName.label: Previous name(s)
previousName.instructions: Have you previously registered to vote under a different name?
previousName.tooltip: If you have previously voted with a different name, your election official may need to look you up using your previous name.

sex.label: Sex
sex.tooltip: Most states do not require gender information, but a few, like ID and SC, still do. If you decline to state a gender and your state requires it, your state must let you know that you need to fill in the missing information.

party.tooltip: Many states require voters to designate a political party to be eligible to vote in primary elections. Choosing a political party is optional.
party.label: Your Political Party

scRules.label: Race
scRules.prevRegLabel: Previous location of registration (if previously registered in a state other than South Carolina)
scRules.prevRegInstructions: You must provide your previous location of registration, if in another state.
scRules.tooltip: Only South Carolina voters need to answer this question as per state law.

receiveBallot.label: How would you like to receive your ballot?
receiveBallot.tooltip: You may request to receive your blank ballot by email/online, fax or mail. We encourage voters to request their blank ballot be sent by email/online or fax to avoid the delay associated with mail  and the possibility the ballot will be lost in transit.

messages.required: This is required.  Please select how you would like to receive your ballot.

joinDa.label: Would you like to Join Democrats Abroad?
joinDa.accountEmail: If you previously joined Democrats Abroad with an email address other than {email}, please enter it so we can update your record.
joinDa.tooltip: Democrats Abroad is the official Democratic Party organization for the millions of Americans living outside the United States.

messages.email: That email address is invalid.  Please try again.

daPrimary.title: Democrats Abroad Global Presidential Primary runs from March 3-10, 2020
daPrimary.home: When you fill out your form, you can confirm you are a Democrats Abroad member --or join!-- and you'll be eligible to vote in the Democrats Abroad Global Presidential Primary.
daPrimary.join: If you confirm you are a Democrats Abroad member --or join by March 10, 2020-- you will be eligible to vote in the Democrats Abroad Global Presidential Primary.

stateSpecial.label: {state} Specific Rules
stateSpecial.tooltipTitle: Why am I being asked this?

vaRules.label: The name of your employer or the name of your spouse's or parent/guardian's employer
vaRules.tooltip: If you don't provide employer you will receive only federal ballots. Only Virginia voters need to answer this question as per state law.

isRegistered.label: Are you already registered to vote in {jurisdiction}?

akRules.label: Please indicate in the box below the document you will be providing. Be sure to include a photocopy when you submit your completed form.
akRules.resInstructions: If you are registering to vote in Alaska, you must also send in a copy of any one (1) of the following documents: valid U.S. passport, or other identification issued under the authority of the United States Secretary of State, or Alaska driver's license, or Alaska state identification, or US birth certificate.
akRules.tooltip: Only Alaska voters need to answer this question as per state law.

fpcaDownload.downloadedAlertMessage: Your form has been downloaded (check your downloads folder).  You must **SIGN, DATE and SEND** it to your election official.
fpcaDownload.downloadingAlertMessage: Clicking 'OK' will open a new window with your completed form. You must **SIGN, DATE and SEND** it to your election official.

voterClass.tooltip:
Voters may choose **I Intend to Return** if they intend to return to the state in which they are registering to vote. An "intention" is sufficient, you don’t need to have a fixed date of return or firm plans. Registering as **Intend to Return **should make you eligible to vote in state and local races. However, it may also make you liable for state income taxes (if applicable in your state).

Voters may choose **My Return is Uncertain** if they do not have a current intention to return to the state in which they are registering to vote. Voters are entitled to receive a ballot for federal offices and may, depending on their state, also receive a ballot for state and local offices.
voterClass.whatCivType: Are you abroad temporarily or indefinitely?
voterClass.whatMilType: What type of military voter are you?
voterClass.civilianOrMilitary: Are you a civilian or military voter?
voterClass.tooltipTitle: Intend to return vs. Return is uncertain

sig.title: Add your scanned signature.
sig.scanInstructions: {0} to scan your signature now with your device camera. Or {1} to upload your signature from a file.
sig.uploadFileImageNoPDF: Or upload an image file, such as jpeg or png, to upload your signature. [pdf files will not work]
sig.clickToUpload: Click to upload a scan of your signature
sig.signName: Sign your name with a dark pen in large letters on a blank sheet of white paper.
sig.adjustAfterTake: You'll be able to adjust the picture after you take it.
sig.adjustAfterUpload: You'll be able to adjust the picture after you upload it.
sig.captureErrorMessage: We could not get access your device camera. (Either it is not connected/available or you have disallowed VoteFromAbroad.org from accessing it). You can still click {0} to upload your signature from a file.
sig.captureSignInstructions: Sign your name with a dark pen in large letters on a blank sheet of white paper. Then click 'Start' to start your camera. You'll be able to adjust the picture after you take it.
sig.captureUploadInstructions: Sign your name with a dark pen in large letters on a blank sheet of white paper. Scan the file to your computer, then click 'Upload a File'. You'll be able to adjust the picture after you upload it.
sig.sigPlacementInstructions: Move your signature in front of the camera so that it is in focus and takes up as much of the screen as possible. (You'll be able to adjust the picture after you take it.)
sig.sigAdjustmentInstructions:
Align your signature with the red line -- drag with your mouse/finger to move, scroll to zoom. If you don't see your signature, you may need to zoom out to get it back on the page.
- Adjust your signature with the 'Line Strength' buttons below so that the signature is clear and has minimal background noise
- If your signature is still unclear, you can click 'Clear Image' to try again.
- Click 'Use This Signature' to add it to your form and compose a message to your election official.
sig.resizeInstructions: Pinch or scroll with your mouse on the image to resize it. Missing pic? Zoom out to find it.
sig.moveInstructions: Drag with you mouse/finger to place your signature on the red line next to the 'X'.
sig.useSignatureInstructions: Click 'Use This Signature' to add it to your form and compose a message to your election official.
sig.tooLargeMessage: That image is too large, please choose a smaller image.
sig.selectInstructions: Select the signature below that is the clearest.  Choose the version that has a white background with a completely visible signature.
sig.invalidImageTypeMessage: We could not process that file type. Please upload a '.jpg' or '.png' image file
sig.invalidImageSizeMessage: That image is too large, please choose a smaller image.
sig.successMessage: Sent! Check your inbox for a copy. ({email})
sig.instructions:
1. Sign your name with a dark pen on a sheet of plain white paper.
Click 'Allow access to my webcam' and accept the following prompt.
3. Hold your signature up in front of the camera and align it above the red signature line, then click 'take photo'
4. Select the clearest version of your signature
5. Click 'Send' to send your signed form to your election official.
sig.name: Name
sig.subject: Subject
sig.sendInstructions: Type a message to include with your email to your local election official. We will attach your completed, signed and dated form. Click 'Send'. We will also send a copy to your email address for your records.
sig.sendTitle: Send to your Local Election Official
sig.capInstructions: Hold your signature up in front of the camera, align it above the red signature line and click 'take photo' to capture your signature.
sig.attachmentInstructions: You are required to provide {document}. Drop your file here or click to upload. (jpg, png, gif or pdf)
sig.attachmentRequiredAlertMessage: You are required to provide {document}. Click cancel to add a file to your email. Or you can send the message without attaching a file. Your election official may contact you to ask for appropriate documentation.
sig.failureMessage: There was an error sending your email. Please try again or return to the last page and download a copy.
sig.signatureAffirmation:
### I swear or affirm, under penalty of perjury that: 
- The information on this form is true, accurate, and complete to the best of my knowledge. I understand that a material misstatement of fact in completion of this document may constitute grounds for conviction of perjury. 
- I am a U.S. citizen, at least 18 years of age (or will be by the day of the election), eligible to vote in the requested jurisdiction, and 
- I am not disqualified to vote due to having been convicted of a felony or other disqualifying offense, nor have I been adjudicated mentally incompetent; or if so, my voting rights have been reinstated; and 
- I am not registering, requesting a ballot, or voting in any other jurisdiction in the United States, except the jurisdiction cited in this voting form.

altEmail.label: If you have a second email address, add it here to ensure ballot delivery.

messages.email: That email address is invalid.  Please try again.

votAdr.tooltip: If you are unsure, use the **residence address** of the last place you lived in the US. If you have never resided in the US, use the residence address of the last place your US parent(s) lived in the US. If your US parents last lived in the US in different locations, you may choose which one to use as your voting address.
votAdr.instructions: Your voting address is _usually_ the last place you lived in the US. If you have never lived in the US, use the last US address of your US citizen parent(s). (Do not enter a PO Box.)

messages.Z-usZip: Enter a valid {state} Zip Code (e.g. {example1} or {example2})

votAdr.label: Voting Address

vAdr.tooltip: If you are unsure, use the **residence address** of the last place you lived in the US. If you have never resided in the US, use the residence address of the last place your US parent(s) lived in the US. If your US parents last lived in the US in different locations, you may choose which one to use as your voting address.
vAdr.instructions: Your voting address is _usually_ the last place you lived in the US. If you have never lived in the US, use the last US address of your US citizen parent(s).

messages.Z-usZip: Enter a valid US Zip Code (e.g. 95014 or 22162-1010)

vAdr.label: Voting Address

prRules.label: Father's and Mother's first names
prRules.parentsInstructions: Puerto Rico requires that you provide your father's and mother's first names.
prRules.tooltip: Only Puerto Rico voters need to answer this question as per territory law.

stages.emailDigiSign: **Capture your signature** with your device camera or **upload** a scan of your signature and email your form straight from this website.
stages.emailUploadSignature: **Upload a scan of your signature** and email your form straight from this website
stages.faxDigiSign: **If you have a camera** on this computertabletphone, you can capture your signature and fax your form straight from this website.
stages.faxConfirm: Confirm with your local election official that they received it.
stages.emailDownload: **If you don't have a camera** on this computertabletphone, you will need to download your form, print, sign, date and scan it.
stages.emailConfirm: Confirm with your local election official that they received it.
stages.faxDownload: **If you don't have a camera** on this computertabletphone, you will need to download your form, print, sign and date it before faxing.
stages.mailConfirm: Confirm with your local election official that they received it.
stages.faxIntro: Sign and send your form by fax
stages.instructions4: Confirm that the following information is correct. If you need to correct anything click 'Back.' When everything is correct click 'Next' for instructions on how to sign and send your form to your election official.
stages.instructions4es: NOTE: The voter registration/ballot request form must be sent to your Local Election Official in English. This is how it will look.
stages.emailIntro: Sign and send your form by email
stages.instructions5: You must send your signed ballot request to {leo} by {options}. Choose how to send your ballot request.
stages.instructions5sub: Choose how to send your ballot request:
stages.mailSign: Print, sign and date your form.
stages.mailIntro: Download, print, sign and send your form by postal mail
stages.choose5: Choose how to send your Ballot request

dob.label: Date of Birth
dob.selectDate:
Type your birthdate in or select your birthdate
(select year first, then month and date).
dob.tooltip: You must be 18 years old by the time of the next General Election to register to vote.
dob.disambiguationMessage: You typed {0}. Which of the following did you mean?

messages.required: Your date of birth is required.
messages.tooYoung: You must turn 18 on or before the next General Election.

vtRules.label: Vermont Voter's Oath
vtRules.oathInstructions: If you have never registered before in Vermont, you must take a self-administered oath or it may be administered by anyone over the age of 18. The Vermont voter's oath is: "You solemnly swear (or affirm) that whenever you give your vote or suffrage, touching any matter that concerns the State of Vermont, you will do it so as in your conscience you shall judge will most conduce to the best good of the same, as established by the Constitution, without fear or favor of any person." Once you have read the Voter's Oath,  write the following: "I swear or affirm that I have taken the VT Voter's Oath."
vtRules.tooltip: Only Vermont voters need to answer this question as per state law.

messages.validPhone: The number you typed is not a valid phone number.  Please enter a valid number (starting with + and country code)

okRules.label: Which Party Primary ballot are you requesting
okRules.primaryInstructions: If your political party affiliation is listed as Independent/No Party, you may be able to request a ballot for a recognized political party's primary election. For specific information about recognized political parties in Oklahoma, please visit [http://www.elections.ok.gov](http://www.elections.ok.gov).
okRules.tooltip: Only Oklahoma voters need to answer this question as per state law.

id.tooltipOptional: {state} does not require identification to request a ballot or register to vote. You may _either_ provide the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number _OR_ your State ID to help your election official find your voting record.
id.instructionsOptional: Optional. Providing **either** the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number **OR** your State ID may help your election official find your voting record.
id.SSN4: the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number

messages.ssn-required: You must provide your full Social Security Number if you have one
messages.ssn-correctLength: You must provide your full Social Security Number if you have one
messages.ssn4-required: You must provide the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number if you have one
messages.ssn4-correctLength: You must provide the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number if you have one
messages.stateId-required: You must provide at least ONE of valid form of ID (from the list above) if you have it.

id.label: Identification
id.tooltipTitle: Why am I being asked this?
id.noid2: I don't have the above identification
id.tooltipReq1:
{state} voters must provide a {id}. 



If you can't find your {id}, please select 

 \*\*'I don't have a {id}.'\*\*. Your local election official will follow up with you if they require more information.
id.tooltipReq2:
**_ONE_** of the following forms of identification is required for {state} voters:

 {allButLastTypes} or {lastType}. 

If you don't have any of these, please select **'I don't have the above identification.'** Your local election official will follow up with you if they require more information.
id.tooltipOkEmail:
Oklahoma voters must provide the last 4 digits of your Social Security Number if you choose to receive your ballot by email. 

 If you don't have a Social Security Number or you can't find it, please select **"I don't have a Social Security Number."** Your local election official will follow up with you if they require more information.
id.instructionsReq1: {state} voters must provide the following ID: {id}.  If you don't have a {idType}, please select: **I don't have a {idType}.**
id.instructionsReq2: {state} voters must provide **ONE** of the following forms of identification: {allButLastTypes}, or your {lastType}. If you don't have any of these, please select **'I don't have the above identification.'**

messages.required: You must enter a first name.

fwdAdr.label: OPTIONAL: Mail Forwarding Address
fwdAdr.instructions: If you would like your ballot sent to a different address such as a P.O. box or forwarding address, enter it here.
fwdAdr.tooltip: This is optional. Please provide a forwarding address only if you request your blank ballot be sent to you by mail and you do not want it mailed to your current residence address outside the US. If you are uncertain what your mailing address will be when ballots are due to be sent out, you may have your blank ballot sent to a reliable third-party, such as a University student office or postal box.
fwdAdr.question: Would you like your ballot sent to a different address than your residential address?

messages.country-required: You must provide your country of residence. (Outside the United States)
messages.alt1-required: Your full street address is required

fwdAdr.unstructured-label: I need to use a different format for my address.
fwdAdr.structured-label: Use the standard international format for my address.

messages.required: Required.  You must add an email address.
messages.email: That email address is invalid.  Please try again.

fax.label: Enter your fax number if you would like to receive your ballot by fax.

messages.required: Your must include a fax number if you choose to receive your ballot by fax.
messages.validPhone: The number you typed is not a valid phone number.  Please enter a valid number (starting with + and country code).

azRules.label: If providing proof of citizenship, please indicate in the box below what documentation you will be providing. You must also attach a photocopy of the documentation when you submit this form.
azRules.citInstructions: If you are using this form to register to vote and you wish to receive a ballot with both state and federal offices, you must provide proof of citizenship.  If you don't provide proof of citizenship when you register to vote, you will receive a ballot listing only federal offices.
azRules.tooltip: Only Arizona voters need to answer this question as per state law.

abrAdr.tooltip: You must provide your current residence address outside the US for informational purposes. Please provide your address outside the US even if you request your blank ballot be sent to you by email/online or fax.

messages.country-required: You must provide your country of residence. (Outside the United States)
messages.US-warning: You should only select 'United States' if you are using a military or diplomatic address (APO/DPO/FPO).
messages.alt1-required: Your full street address is required

abrAdr.label: Your current address abroad
abrAdr.noAutocomplete: Unable to retrieve address. Please enter manually.
abrAdr.unstructured-label: I need to use a different format for my address.
abrAdr.structured-label: Use the standard international format for my address.

deadlineLanguage.CTSpecial: {default}We recommend sending in your FPCA electronically to make sure you are on the voter rolls and will get a ballot. If you send in your form by email or fax {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.CTSpecialDeadline: you must ALSO send in the original signed copy by postal mail and it must be received in Connecticut by the close of polls on Election Day.
deadlineLanguage.NYSpecial: {default}We recommend sending in your FPCA electronically to make sure you are on the voter rolls and will get a ballot.  If you send in your form by email or fax {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.NYSpecialDeadline: you must ALSO send in the original signed copy by postal mail and it must be postmarked by Election Day and reach NY by Nov 19.
deadlineLanguage.NJSpecial: {default}We recommend sending in your FPCA electronically to make sure you are on the voter rolls and will get a ballot.
deadlineLanguage.WYSpecial: If you previously registered in state you may email, fax or mail your signed form to the {leoName}. If you are registering to vote or previously registered to vote using the FPCA, you MUST send in your original signed form by POSTAL MAIL by the deadline to register to vote. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.ARSpecial: {default}We recommend sending your ballot request by email if possible to avoid possible postal delays. If you send in your form by email or fax, {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.ARSpecialDeadline: you should ALSO check with the {leoName} to determine if they also require the original signed copy by postal mail.
deadlineLanguage.VTSpecialDeadline: If you submit your form electronically, we recommend sending in your form by email. If you send in your form by fax, you must ALSO send in the original signed copy by postal mail and it must be received in Vermont by the close of polls on Election Day.
deadlineLanguage.TXSpecialDeadline: If you submit your form electronically, we recommend sending in your form by email. If you send in your form by fax, you must ALSO send in the original signed copy by postal mail and it must be received in Texas by the fourth (4th) business day after the fax.
deadlineLanguage.FLSpecial: If you are registering to vote, you must submit your original *signed and dated* form by postal mail to the {leoName}. If you are already registered to vote, you may submit your form by email, fax or postal mail. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.IDSpecial: If you are registering to vote, you must submit your original *signed and dated* form by postal mail to the {leoName}. If you are already registered to vote, you may submit your form by email, fax or postal mail. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.MDSpecial: If you are registering to vote, you must submit your original *signed and dated* form by postal mail to the {leoName}. If you are already registered to vote, you may submit your form by email, fax or postal mail. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.ORSpecial: If you are registering to vote, you must submit your original *signed and dated* form by postal mail to the {leoName}. If you are already registered to vote, you may submit your form by email, fax or postal mail. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.SDSpecial: If you are registering to vote, you must submit your original *signed and dated* form by postal mail to the {leoName}. If you are already registered to vote, you may submit your form by email, fax or postal mail. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.WISpecial: If you are registering to vote, you must submit your original *signed and dated* form by postal mail to the {leoName}. If you are already registered to vote, you may submit your form by email, fax or postal mail. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.CASpecial: If you are registering to vote, you may submit your *signed and dated* form by fax or postal mail. If you are already registered to vote, you may submit your form by email, fax or postal mail. {specialDeadline}
deadlineLanguage.noElections: There are no elections currently scheduled for {state}.  Voters should send in an FPCA every calendar year.
deadlineLanguage.formSubmitted: Your {alsoVoterRegistration}Ballot Request has been submitted by email to {leoName}. {specialRules}
deadlineLanguage.formConfirmation: We also strongly recommend that you verify with your election official that they have received and processed your form.
deadlineLanguage.sendBallot45days: Election Officials are required by Federal law to send ballots to overseas voters at least 45 days prior to an election.
deadlineLanguage.sendBallotLessThan45days: Your Election Official should have already started sending ballots to overseas voters.
deadlineLanguage.ballotReturn:
Be sure to return your voted ballot on time. Your ballot must be {rule} {deadline}{submissionMethod}{alternateSubmissionMethod} for your vote to be counted in the {electionDay} {electionType}. {note}
- See all your state deadlines at {url}/states/{state}
deadlineLanguage.transmitInstructions: You must {transmitOpts} your **signed and dated** ballot request to the {leoName}.
deadlineLanguage.emailSuggested: We recommend sending your ballot request by email if possible to avoid possible postal delays.

notes.AL1: Ballots must still be received by the 7th day after the election.
notes.AL2: Online voting is available only if a voter requests that their ballot be sent to them by email/online.
notes.AK1: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by 8pm on Fri, Aug 28, 2020.
notes.AK2: If sent from outside the US, ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Wed, Nov 18, 2020. If sent from within the US, ballots must be received by Fri, Nov 13, 2020.
notes.AR21: Ballot Request form may be submitted by Email and Fax in most counties. Contact your Local Election Official to confirm they will accept the form by Email or Fax.
notes.AR22: Ballots must be received by Fri, Mar 13, 2018.
notes.AR23: Ballots must be received by Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.AR24: Ballots must be received by Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.AR25: Ballots must be received by Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.AR26: Ballots must be received by Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.CA21: Ballot Request not required if registered and voted in any of the last 4 elections.
notes.CA22: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Fri, Mar 6, 2020.
notes.CA23: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Fri, May 15, 2020.
notes.CO21: Registrations sent by postal mail must be received by Wed, Nov 14, 2018.
notes.CO22: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Wed, Nov 14, 2018.
notes.CT21: If you send in your FPCA by email, you must ALSO place the original FPCA in the outer envelope when mailing in your voted ballot.
notes.FL21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Fri, Jun 28th.
notes.GA21: Registrations sent by postal mail must be received by Fri, Oct 12, 2018.
notes.GA22: Ballots must be received by Fri, Dec 7, 2018.
notes.GU21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.IL1: Requests signed by Sun, Oct 4, 2020 are eligible for a ballot. Otherwise you will only receive a Federal Ballot.
notes.IL21: If you are already registered or if you are not registered but only requesting a federal ballot, your form must be received by Mon, Oct 29, 2018.
notes.IL22: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Tue, Nov 20, 2018.
notes.IN21: If sent from outside the US, ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Fri, Nov 16, 2018. If sent from within the US, ballots must be received by noon on Tue, Nov 6, 2018.  If you intend to return your overseas ballot from Inside the US, contact your Local Election Official to confirm your ballot will be accepted
notes.IA21: Ballot sent by postal mail must be received by Mon, Nov 12, 2018.
notes.IA22: Email or fax ballot return available only if in hostile fire area.
notes.LA21: State ID required for online registration.
notes.LA22: Return by Fax available only by prior arrangement with your election official.
notes.MD21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by 10am on Friday, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.MD22: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by 10am on Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.MA21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by 8pm on Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.MO21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by noon on Fri, Nov 9, 2018.
notes.MO22: Ballots will only be accepted electronically if you are in a hostile fire area.
notes.MT21: If voting by FWAB, your FWAB ballot must be Postmarked by Tues Nov 6, 2018 and Received by 3pm Mon, Nov 12, 2018
notes.NV1: Mail ballots must be Received by Nov 10, 2020.
notes.NE21: Email or Fax ballot return available only by prior arrangement with Local Election Official
notes.NJ21: IMPORTANT: If you submit an FPCA or return your ballot electronically, you must also mail the original at the same time.
notes.NY21: If you submit your FPCA electronically, must ALSO send in the original signed copy by postal mail and it must be postmarked by Election Day and reach NY by Nov 19.
notes.NY22: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Nov 19, 2018.
notes.NC21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by 5pm Thurs, Sept 19, 2019.
notes.ND21: Ballot sent by postal mail must be received by Mon, Nov 12.
notes.OH21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Fri, Nov 16, 2018.
notes.PA21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by 5pm on Tue, May 28, 2019.
notes.SC21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by 5pm on Thu, Nov 8, 2018.
notes.TX21: If you register for a Federal only ballot your registration will be accepted until Fri, Oct 26, 2018.
notes.TX22: Ballots must be received by Tue, Nov 13, 2018. You may only send your ballot by email or fax if you are in a hostile fire area.
notes.UT1: Mail ballots must be Received by Nov 16, 2020, 5:00 PM.
notes.UT21: If an overseas voter uses a FWAB to register to vote, the deadline to register to vote is extended to Nov 1, 2018.
notes.UT22: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Mon, Nov 19, 2018.
notes.WA21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Mon, Nov 26, 2018.
notes.WV21: Ballots sent by postal mail must be received by Mon, Nov 12, 2018.
notes.WY21: Overseas voters who used the FCPA to register to vote must re-register every calendar year in which they wish to vote.
notes.WY22: Only applicable to voters who registered to vote using WY state forms

dashboard.thankYou: Thank you for using VoteFromAbroad to generate your Voter Registration/Ballot Request form.
dashboard.formSubmitted: Your form has been emailed to your election official.
dashboard.requiresSubmit: **Be sure to submit your form** to your Local Election Official before the deadline.
dashboard.helpThanks:
If you need any help, contact our volunteer voter support team at: [help@votefromabroad.org](mailto:help@votefromabroad.org).
Thanks for voting!
dashboard.verify: We also strongly recommend that you verify with you election official that they have received and processed your form.  You can reach your election official with the following:
dashboard.makeChanges: If you discover a mistake and need to change anything on your form, click here to go back. If you are finished, please close the browser window to delete any information saved in this session. Or
dashboard.clearSession: clear your information and start a new request.

fill.title: Fill & Sign
fill.content: You must completely fill out your ballot request, sign and date it before sending it in.

receive.title: Receive Ballot
receive.content: States must send out ballots at least 45 days prior to an election.  We recomend confirming with your local election official that they have accepted your request.

learn.title: Learn
learn.content: about your rights as a voter abroad

send.title: Send
send.content: You must submit your signed and dated request to { leo }. their contact information is below.

vote.title: Vote
vote.content: Be sure to send in your voted ballot on time.  It must be {rule} by {deadline}

dashboard.subtitle: Next Steps...
dashboard.title: Ballot Request Status

share.title: Share
share.content: Ask your friends to vote from abroad
